page.title: 09CREWE PARK, CREWE
page.content: { CREWE PARK,CREWE.} Queen's Park was opened by{H.R.H. Duke {of Cambridge}on 9th June 1888 to celebrate the Jubilee of{Queen {Victoria,}and the opening of the{Grand {Junction Railway.}It was donated to the people of Crewe by the{London and {North Western Railway. There are lots of things to do in the park. There is a lake and you can fish in it or hire a boat. In the lake there is an island.This is a war memorial called{Burma Star Island. There are beautiful flower gardens; a crazy golf course; a childrens play ground; a small pets cage; two bandstands; and a cafe. The cafe is called the{Jubilee Cafe}because it was opened in 1977_the Queen's Jubilee year. The previous cafe was destroyed by fire. The park is a very quiet and peaceful place.
